column1: Santa Anita is a station on the Mexico City Metro. Located in Mexico City's Iztacalco borough
column2: the station is the current terminal of Line 4.

column1: The station logo depicts a man sailing a canoe. This is because in the early 20th century
column2: in the area where the station now stands
column3: was the Santa Anita canal – a place used for  chinampa-based  agriculture. Today the canal has long since vanished
column4: but the name Santa Anita is still used by the surrounding neighbourhood.

column1: Metro Line 4 was originally projected to end in the Villa Coapa neighbourhood
column2: in the southern borough of Coyoacán. Since the inauguration of Line B
column4: no more lines have been constructed or extended
column5: so Metro Santa Anita – and other stations
column6: such as  Metro Barranca del Muerto – officially remain provisional terminals. Metro Santa Anita is the least busy station on the Mexico City Metro
column8: 867 passenger boardings in 2008.Metro Santa Anita was originally to be named "Plutarco E. Calles"
column9: in honor of President Plutarco Elías Calles
column10: according to early plans for Line 4.
